revised_title: Understanding Self-Oscillatory Modes of Fatigue Fracture and Self-Similar Structures
tldr: This article explores the self-oscillatory modes of fatigue fracture and the formation of self-similar structures at the fracture surface. The authors discuss the existence of discontinuities in the fatigue fracture kinetic diagrams and the appearance of an intermediate asymptotic self-similar regime during crack propagation. They propose a model to explain these phenomena and highlight the importance of understanding these processes for future research.
